name: optuna-integration

chunks.text:
Optuna-Integration

(https://www.python.org)
(https://pypi.python.org/pypi/optuna-integration)
(https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/optuna-integration)
(https://github.com/optuna/optuna-integration)
(https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/)

This package is an integration module of [Optuna](https://github.com/optuna/optuna), an automatic Hyperparameter optimization software framework.
The modules in this package provide users with extended functionalities for Optuna in combination with third-party libraries such as PyTorch, sklearn, and TensorFlow.

> [!NOTE]
> You can find more information in [**our official documentations**](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/) and [**API reference**](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html).

Installation

Optuna-Integration is available via [pip](https://pypi.org/project/optuna-integration/) and
on [conda](https://anaconda.org/conda-forge/optuna-integration).

> [!IMPORTANT]
> As dependencies of all the modules are large and complicated, the commands above install only the common dependencies.
> Dependencies for each module can be installed via pip.
> For example, if you would like to install the dependencies of `optuna_integration.botorch` and `optuna_integration.lightgbm`, you can install them via:
> 

> [!NOTE]
> Optuna-Integration supports from Python 3.9 to Python 3.13.
> Optuna Docker image is also provided at [DockerHub](https://hub.docker.com/r/optuna/optuna).

Integration Modules

Here is the table of `optuna-integration` modules:

Third Party Library
:--
[BoTorch](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#botorch)
[CatBoost](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#catboost)
[Dask](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#dask)
[FastAI](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#fast-ai)
[Keras](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#keras)
[LightGBM](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#lightgbm)
[MLflow](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#mlflow)
[PyTorch Distributed](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#pytorch)
[PyTorch Ignite](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#pytorch)
[PyTorch Lightning](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#pytorch)
[pycma](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#pycma)
[SHAP](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#shap)
[scikit-learn](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#sklearn)
[skorch](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#skorch)
[TensorBoard](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#tensorboard)
[tf.keras](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#tensorflow)
[Weights & Biases](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#wandb)
[XGBoost](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#xgboost)
[AllenNLP](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#allennlp)*
[Chainer](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#chainer)*
[ChainerMN](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#chainermn)*
[MXNet](https://optuna-integration.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference/index.html#mxnet)*

> [!WARNING]
> `*` shows deprecated modules and they might be removed in the future.

Communication

* [GitHub Discussions] for questions.
* [GitHub Issues] for bug reports and feature requests.

Contribution

Any contributions to Optuna-Integration are more than welcome!

For general guidelines how to contribute to the project, take a look at [CONTRIBUTING.md](./CONTRIBUTING.md).

Reference

If you use Optuna in one of your research projects, please cite [our KDD paper](https://doi.org/10.1145/3292500.3330701) "Optuna: A Next-generation Hyperparameter Optimization Framework":

BibTeX

usage_description:
Here is a 2-sentence summary of what a developer can achieve with this library:

This library is used to enhance the capabilities of Optuna, allowing developers to seamlessly integrate it with third-party libraries such as PyTorch and TensorFlow for efficient hyperparameter optimization. With optuna-integration, developers can leverage extended functionalities to automate the process of tuning hyperparameters, leading to improved model performance and faster development cycles.
